key_points: The Suez Canal is blocked by the Ever Given, a huge container ship that ran aground.
Eight tug boats and a digger are working to dislodge and refloat the Ever Given.
The Ever Given, operated by Evergreen Marine, got stuck due to bad weather.
Social media user Julianne Cona reported the ship being stuck sideways in the canal.
Before getting lodged, the Ever Given charted a course resembling a crude image in the Red Sea.
Tracking data from vesselfinder.com and myshiptracking.com showed the unusual route.
Vesselfinder.com spokesperson, Mihail Mitev, confirmed the tracking data's accuracy.
The Ever Given was traveling from China to the Netherlands, likely making it heavily laden with goods.
Attempts to get the Ever Given unstuck and traffic flowing again have so far failed.
The incident has prompted a significant backlog of ships waiting to pass through the Suez Canal.
